conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph of two cars, A and B, traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The graph shows the velocity of each car as a function of time.
Identify the initial conditions: At t = 0, both cars are at rest.
The velocity of Car A is 40 m/s, and Car B is at rest.
Determine the time when the cars are side by side. At t = 30 seconds, both cars are moving in the same direction.
Calculate the maximum distance between the cars. The maximum distance will be the difference in their positions at t = 30 seconds.
At t = 30 seconds, the velocity of Car A is 40 m/s, and the velocity of Car B is 0 m/s.
The distance between them at t = 30 seconds can be calculated using the formula: Distance = Initial distance + Velocity of Car A × Time - Velocity of Car B × Time.
Since the initial distance is 0, the distance between the cars at t = 30 seconds is: Distance = 40 × 30 - 0 × 30 = 1200 m.
Since the cars are moving in the same direction, the maximum distance between them is 1200 meters.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 1200 meters.
